What do you want to test?

1. My JSP tag processes different calls correctl=
y.
2. The framework knows when/how to call my JSP tag handler.
3. My JSP ta=
g is registered correctly.

There are probably others.

To test #1, instant=
iate your TagHandler and call methods. If you don't like that, instantiate =
a JspProcessor and send it XML fragments.

Maybe #2 doesn't make sense. I j=
ust wrote it as I was thinking about it.

To test #3, check it by hand once=
 then use the Golden Master technique of comparing future generations of th=
e XML fragment to the hand-checked Golden Master.

If you want to test from=
 end to end, look at HTMLUnit.

Take care.

>So said luca passani on 4/26/2=
003 --------------------
>

ag-lib to be used
>with tomcat and other application servers. I would like =
to be able to
>unit-test the tags automatically, but the way to do that is =
not obvious.
>

ages, but I
>think
>it would be more elegant if it all could be made automa=
tically from ant

>
>I have noticed that there are a =
few utils to do that, but I am confused.
>Do I need tomcat installed? or no=
t?

string for each request.

I compare mark-ups  without getting those extra whitespaces

 I need to build my  own 'equals' methods using RegExps?
